newFeatures.title: Track “Current Streak Duration” and “Longest Streak Duration” Attributes
newFeatures.plan: Shopify & Salla: Free / Pro / GURU · Selfserve: Starter / Growth / Enterprise
newFeatures.description:
As a Gameball client,

I want to track customers’ current and longest streak durations using a dedicated streak achievement event,
So that I can trigger automations and communication campaigns based on real-time streak behavior and keep customers engaged.

capabilities.title: Key Capabilities
items:
Acceptance Criteria

When a customer achieves a streak interval (e.g., completes a daily action for a streak campaign), the system fires a streak achievement event.

The event is fired every time the customer successfully progresses their streak (not only when the streak is completed or broken).

The event payload includes the following attributes:

  • Streak Campaign ID

  • Streak Campaign Name

  • Current Streak Duration (numeric)

  • Longest Streak Duration (numeric)

Each streak campaign fires its own event independently, allowing multiple streaks to be tracked in parallel for the same customer.

The event reflects the updated streak values after the streak calculation is completed for that interval.

The event is available across Gameball as a trigger and condition, including:

  • Automation entry triggers

  • Automation conditions

  • Communication campaign triggers

  • Event-based segmentation rules

Clients can configure campaigns such as:

  • Sending a notification when a customer reaches a specific streak duration

  • Triggering encouragement messages when a streak is ongoing

  • Rewarding customers when they beat their longest streak

If a customer misses a streak interval and the streak resets, no streak achievement event is fired for that interval.

Event naming and structure are consistent and documented so clients can easily identify and use streak-related data.

The event can be used alongside existing customer attributes, allowing clients to combine real-time streak behavior with profile-based segmentation and personalization.

newFeatures.title: Add Attribute for Total Achieved Reward Campaigns
newFeatures.plan: Shopify & Salla: Free / Pro / GURU · Selfserve: Starter / Growth / Enterprise
newFeatures.description:
As a Gameball client,
I want to have a calculated customer attribute that represents the total number of reward campaigns a customer has achieved,
So that I can use this value for segmentation, personalization, and advanced logic across different Gameball modules.

capabilities.title: Key Capabilities
items:
Acceptance Criteria:

  • A new preserved customer attribute is introduced to track the total number of achieved reward campaigns per customer.

  • The attribute automatically increments whenever a customer successfully completes and achieves a reward campaign.

  • Only successfully completed reward campaigns are counted; incomplete, failed, or disqualified campaigns are excluded.

  • Streaks Reward campaigns counts one-time not for every streak day

  • The attribute is stored and maintained by the system and does not require manual updates from the client.

  • The attribute is available as a filter in segmentation rules.

  • The attribute is available as a variable in:

    • Automations

    • Notifications

    • Communication campaigns

  • The attribute value reflects real-time or near real-time updates after a campaign is achieved.

  • Existing customer data remains unaffected, and historical achieved campaigns are correctly reflected in the calculated value.

  • The attribute follows standard naming and formatting conventions used for customer attributes.

newFeatures.title: Add Campaign Channel Filter to Communication Campaigns
newFeatures.plan: Shopify & Salla: Free / Pro / GURU · Selfserve: Starter / Growth / Enterprise
newFeatures.description:
User Story

As a client (merchant/business owner)
I want to filter communication campaigns by campaign channel (Web, Email, Push Notification, SMS, WhatsApp)
So that I can quickly view and manage only the campaigns for a specific channel without scrolling through all campaign channels

Description

Currently, the communication campaigns list in the dashboard displays all campaigns regardless of their channel. Clients who run campaigns across multiple channels (Web, Email, Push Notification, SMS, WhatsApp) must manually scan through the entire list to find campaigns for a specific channel. This becomes increasingly difficult as the number of campaigns grows.

This feature introduces a campaign type filter within the communication campaigns section of the dashboard. Clients will be able to select one or more campaign types to narrow down the campaign list view, making it faster and easier to locate, review, and manage campaigns for a specific channel.

Impacted areas include the Dashboard UI (Communication Campaigns list/table), the campaign listing API endpoint (filter parameter support), and potentially the campaign data model if a type field is not already indexed.

capabilities.title: Key Capabilities
items:
Acceptance Criteria

Functional Requirements

  • Clients can select a single campaign type to filter the list
  • Clients can select multiple campaign types simultaneously to view campaigns across selected channels
  • The filter supports the following campaign types: Web, Email, Push Notification, SMS, WhatsApp

Behavior and Logic

  • When a filter is applied, the campaign list updates immediately to show only campaigns matching the selected type(s)
  • The filter persists during the current session (navigating away and back retains the selected filter)
  • The campaign count/total updates to reflect the filtered results
  • Pagination resets to page 1 when a filter is applied or changed
  • The filter works in combination with any existing filters (e.g., status, Audience) or search functionality
  • If no campaigns match the selected filter, a clear empty state message is displayed

Backward Compatibility

  • The existing campaign list view remains unchanged when no filter is applied (default All state)
  • No changes to how campaigns are created or stored

Security and Permissions

  • The filter is available to all users who have access to the communication campaigns section
  • Filter results respect existing permission boundaries, clients can only see their own campaigns

Documentation

  • Update the dashboard user guide with instructions on how to use the campaign type filter
  • Update the API documentation to reflect the new filter query parameter
  • Include the filter feature in the release notes

Plans

  • Shopify: Starter, Pro, GURU
  • Salla: Pro, GURU
  • Enterprise

newFeatures.title: Custom Earn Options for Line Items (Phase II)
newFeatures.plan: Shopify & Salla: Free / Pro / GURU · Selfserve: Starter / Growth / Enterprise
newFeatures.description:
User Story

As a Client
I want Configure custom earning rules for line items based on various attributes
So that Increased flexibility and control over earning points for clients

Description

Currently, clients can only include or exclude order/line items from earning points through the system, but they lack the ability to create custom earning rules based on specific attributes such as collections, merchants, payment methods, and other attributes.

Introduce custom earn options for line items, allowing clients to create specific earning rules for different attributes, such as collections, merchants, payment methods, and any other attribute they have inside the order. This will enable clients to have more control over how points are earned and to create more targeted and effective earning strategies.

The earn section, line items, order attributes, and extra attributes for line items will be impacted by this change. The system will need to be updated to accommodate the new custom earning rules and to process the new attribute data correctly.

Plans

  • Shopify: GURU
  • Salla: GURU
  • Enterprise: Custom

capabilities.title: Key Capabilities
items:
Functional Requirements

  • Allow clients to create custom earning rules for line items based on various attributes such as collections, merchants, payment methods, and other attributes
  • Enable clients to set specific earning rates for different attributes, such as earning 2 points for every 1 EGP paid for a specific collection
  • Provide an option for clients to exclude certain attributes or line items from earning points
  • Allow clients to use extra attributes for line items to create custom earning rules
  • Validate that the custom earning rules are correctly applied to line items and orders
  • Ensure that the system can handle a large number of custom earning rules without impacting performance

Behavior & Logic

  • The system should evaluate the custom earning rules for each line item and apply the corresponding earning rate
  • If multiple custom earning rules apply to a single line item, the system should use the most specific rule
  • If a client sets a custom earning rule for a specific attribute, the system should override the default earning rate for that attribute
  • The system should handle cases where a client sets conflicting custom earning rules, such as earning 2 points for a specific collection and excluding that collection from earning points
  • The system should provide an interface for clients to manage and edit their custom earning rules
  • The system should validate that the custom earning rules are correctly formatted and do not contain any errors

Validation & Error Handling

  • Validate that the custom earning rules are correctly formatted and contain all required information
  • Check that the custom earning rules do not contain any conflicts or errors
  • Handle cases where a client attempts to create a custom earning rule with invalid or missing information
  • Provide clear and concise error messages to clients when errors occur

Data Accuracy & Consistency

  • Ensure that the custom earning rules are accurately stored and retrieved from the database
  • Validate that the custom earning rules are correctly applied to line items and orders
  • Check that the earning rates calculated using the custom earning rules are accurate and consistent
  • Prevent data corruption or loss when updating or deleting custom earning rules
  • Ensure that the system can handle a large volume of custom earning rules without impacting data accuracy
  • Provide a mechanism for auditing and verifying the accuracy of the custom earning rules

Backward Compatibility

  • Ensure that the new custom earning rules feature does not break existing functionality or earning rules
  • Provide a mechanism for clients to migrate their existing earning rules to the new custom earning rules format
  • Handle cases where a client has existing earning rules that are incompatible with the new custom earning rules feature
  • Provide clear and concise documentation for clients on how to use the new custom earning rules feature

Performance & Scalability

  • Ensure that the system can handle 10 custom earning rules without impacting performance

improvements.title: Revamp Earning Rules & Points Multiplier Campaigns
improvements.overview:
As a Gameball client

I want more advanced configuration options for earning rules and point multiplier campaigns, allowing me to include or exclude any order attributes and apply multipliers with full flexibility

So that I can create precise, targeted earning logic that matches my business model and gives me full control over how points are awarded.

whatsNew.title: What's New
items:
1. Earning Rules Revamp

1.1 Include/Exclude Order Attributes

  • Clients can include specific attributes from the Order API to define what qualifies for earning points.

  • Clients can exclude specific attributes from the Order API to define what cannot earn points.

  • Available attributes for include/exclude must include (but are not limited to):

    • Category

    • Collection

    • Vendor

    • Product

    • Extra: Payment Method

    • Channel (web, POS, call center)

    • Tags

    • Any field sent in the order API payload

1.2 Attribute Selection Behavior

  • If one or more attributes are added to the “Include” list, then:

    • Only attributes matching those rules earn points

    • Any attribute not matching them earns zero points

  • If attributes are added to the “Exclude” list, then:

    • Items matching those attributes earn zero points

    • All others earn points normally

1.3 Calculation Logic

  • The system evaluates:

    1. Include rules (if any)

    2. Exclude rules

    3. Standard earning calculation

  • If multiple attributes match include/exclude logic, the strictest rule applies:

    • Exclude overrides include

2. Points Multiplier Campaigns Expansion

2.1 Add All Order API Attributes

  • Clients can apply multipliers based on:

    • Quantity

    • Vendor

    • Collection

    • Category

    • Product Name

    • Payment Method

    • Channel

    • Tags

    • Custom order metadata

    • Any attribute sent in the Order API

2.2 Flexible Multiplier Conditions

  • Clients can configure:

    • Single attribute multipliers (e.g., 2X on Vendor = Nike)

    • Multi-attribute combinations (e.g., 3X for Category includes Shoes AND Payment Method = Online Payment)

    • Quantity-based multipliers (e.g., 1.5X for quantity ≥ 3)

2.3 UI Improvements

  • Attribute selection uses dropdowns populated automatically from Order API values.

  • Clients can add multiple multiplier conditions (same UX as existing rule builder).

2.4 Calculation Logic

  • Points multiplier is applied after evaluating earning rules.

  • If multiple multipliers match the order:

    • The highest multiplier is applied

3. Attributes Operators: 
3.1 Strings: 
  • Equals
  • Contains
  • Starts With -New-
3.2 Numbers
  • Equals
  • Greater Than or Equals
  • Between

improvements.title: Enterprise Data Migration Framework
improvements.overview:
Overview

Enterprise clients migrating to our loyalty system need to bring their full historical context with them, not just future activity. This includes customers, orders, and loyalty transactions. Each client’s data model differs significantly, creating friction, custom work, and long onboarding timelines.

This feature introduces a three-layer migration framework that allows enterprise clients to import customers, orders, and loyalty transaction history in any structure, map them to our system, and ensure the loyalty engine (RFM, tiers, points) functions accurately from day one.

Problem Statement

When large clients migrate to our loyalty system:

  • Their customer schemas include many attributes not natively supported by our system.

  • Their order data varies widely in structure and semantics.

  • Their loyalty transaction history (points earned, redeemed, expired) must be preserved to maintain customer trust.

Without a unified migration solution:

  • Integrations require custom engineering per client.

  • Customers lose historical points, tiers, or personalization.

  • RFM insights and tier logic are inaccurate.

  • Loyalty launches are delayed, increasing churn and reducing deal confidence.

Goals

  • Enable seamless migration of all customer, order, and loyalty transaction data

  • Preserve customer value (points, tiers, history)

  • Minimize custom engineering work

  • Ensure loyalty analytics and engines work correctly from day one

whatsNew.title: What's New
items:
Layer 1: Customer Data Migration

Description

Enable clients to import their entire customer base, including all attributes, whether natively supported or not.

Key Capabilities

  • Import customers via batch (CSV/JSON) 

  • Map known attributes to native customer fields (e.g., email, phone, birthday)

  • Automatically store unsupported attributes as custom attributes

  • Preserve customer identifiers for cross-layer linking (orders & transactions)

Acceptance Criteria

  • All customers are created or updated successfully

  • No customer attributes are dropped

  • Unsupported attributes are accessible in the customer profile

  • Customer records are linkable to orders and transactions

Layer 2: Order Data Migration (Purchases)

Description

Allow clients to import historical and ongoing order data in any format and map it to the platform’s internal order model.

Key Capabilities

  • Configurable field mapping to internal order schema

  • Order normalization (dates, totals, etc..)

  • Support historical orders without triggering duplicate rewards

  • Feed imported orders into:

    • RFM engine

    • Tier evaluation

    • Points calculation (optional)

Acceptance Criteria

  • Imported orders are persisted in the internal order model

  • RFM scores update correctly based on historical orders

  • Tier assignment reflects historical spending

  • Orders are deduplicated and auditable

Layer 3: Loyalty Transaction History Migration

Description

Enable migration of all loyalty-related transactions, including:

  • Points earned

  • Points redeemed

  • Points expired or adjusted

This ensures continuity of customer balances and trust.

Key Capabilities

  • Import transaction logs tied to customer identifiers

  • Support multiple transaction types:

    • Earn

    • Redeem

    • Expire

    • Manual adjustments

  • Preserve original timestamps and references

  • Maintain correct running points balance

  • Flag migrated transactions as historical

Acceptance Criteria

  • Customer points balances match pre-migration balances

  • All transaction types are reflected in customer history

  • No duplicate or conflicting transactions are created

  • Transactions are auditable and traceable to migration jobs

improvements.title: Improve Quiz Ranking Logic to Reduce Score Ties and Ensure Fair Winner Selection
improvements.overview:
As a client running quizzes and competitions
I want a fair and transparent ranking system that minimizes tied scores
So that I can clearly identify top winners and reward customers accurately.

Problem Statement

Currently, each correct quiz answer awards 10 points plus a timer-based bonus.
In cases where clients configure the timer to exceed 10 seconds, the timer bonus can exceed the base question score, leading to:

  • Disproportionately high bonus points

  • Many customers ending with identical total scores

  • Scenarios where 20–100 users are tied, making it difficult to select a clear top 5 or top 10 winners

Proposed Improvements

To ensure fairer ranking and clearer winner selection, the quiz ranking logic will be enhanced through the following changes:

  1. Additional Ranking Layers (Tie-Breakers)

    • Total number of correct answers across all quiz days

    • Total time taken to complete all quiz questions across all days

  2. Score Balance Adjustment

    • Each correct question will award a fixed 100 points

    • Timer bonus will always be lower than the question score

    • Accuracy is prioritized over speed, while speed still matters

  3. Timer Cap

    • Maximum timer value capped at 99 seconds

    • Prevents excessively high bonus scores due to long timers

  4. Transparency

    • A hint or tooltip will be added to the leaderboard

    • Explains how customers are ranked when scores are tied

These changes aim to significantly reduce score ties and improve fairness across all clients.

whatsNew.title: What's New
items:
Acceptance Criteria

Scoring Logic

  • Each correct answer awards a fixed 100 base points.

  • Timer bonus is calculated separately and is always less than the base question score.

  • Timer values greater than 99 seconds are capped at 99 seconds for bonus calculation.

Ranking & Tie-Breakers

  • Customers are primarily ranked by total score.

  • In the case of tied scores, ranking is resolved using the following tie-breakers in order:

    1. Total number of correct answers across all quiz days

    2. Total time taken to complete all quiz questions across all days

  • If all ranking layers are identical, customers retain the same rank.

Data Accuracy

  • Correct answer count and total time are accurately aggregated across all quiz days.

  • Ranking calculations are consistent across leaderboard views and exports.

Leaderboard Transparency

  • The leaderboard includes a hint or tooltip explaining:

    • How scores are calculated

    • How ties are resolved

  • The explanation is written in clear, customer-friendly language.

Backward Compatibility

  • Existing quizzes continue to function without data loss.

  • Ranking logic updates apply to new and ongoing quizzes where applicable.

  • No breaking changes are introduced to leaderboard APIs.

Performance

  • Ranking recalculation does not introduce noticeable delays.

  • Leaderboard updates remain performant for large participant counts.
